Node.definition: = action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a reference to the day after the current day
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= causative process by which something is caused to happen

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective
= state in which objects are relatively heavy

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= causative action by which humans cause (other) humans or deities to experience displeasure ◄ by their words or behavior
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

Node.gloss: to be heavy|to be serious|to be grievous|to be burdensome|to be strong
Node.definition: = state in which an event is weighing heavily on the mind of those undergoing it
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= state of being without mercy towards humans and animals
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= process by which certain information becomes publicly available
= affection between people, or between people and deities

Node.gloss: to hide|to keep from knowing|to conceal
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause others not to be aware of certain information, ◄ as if by physically hiding it
= state in which an event is likely to last for a long time, ≈ which can be either good or bad
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by accident or aggression; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection

Node.gloss: to be abundant (but not to be trusted)
Node.definition: = state in which events happen frequently
= the touch of the lips or the lips and cheeks between two people ► usually as a sign of love and desire, but also to greet or show respect
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= state in which humans regard something with distaste
= virgin honey (דְּבַשׁ) dripping straight from the honeycomb; ≈ regarded as very desirable food of high quality

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness
= state in which a substance has a sharp, pungent taste, ≈ associated with desperation and distress
= state in which food tastes well

= small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten
= action by which humans and animals leave their home or move about from place to place without clear destination
= structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security
= action by which humans and animals leave their home or move about from place to place without clear destination

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= substance ◄ made from tree gum or bark ► to make a sweet smell; it is burned in a censer or on an open fire ≈ to provide a sweet aroma pleasing to God
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which a condition is experienced as pleasing
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to respond|to bring back word|to report
Node.definition: literally: to bring back word; hence: = action by which humans respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= generic designation for any article of clothing

Node.gloss: to pledge|to promise|to put up security
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of
Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else
= person who comes from a foreign country and therefore has a different status from those who are native born
= to seize an object as a pledge for a loan

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

= actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

Node.gloss: to consider someone guilty of something|to credit someone for something
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities hold the opinion that an event or situation is to be considered a particular person's responsibility
= the process where by drops of liquid fall down through a hole or crack ≈ and produce an irritating sound
= process by which something persists in a certain way or state; ≈ associated with being irritating, troublesome

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a prolonged period of rain
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= causative action by which humans keep other humans, their minds, or forces of nature from being engaged in a certain event
= causative action by which humans keep other humans, their minds, or forces of nature from being engaged in a certain event

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= causative action by which humans use an iron tool to cause an object to have a thin cutting edge, ► in order to make it useful and effective as a tool; ≈ often associated with aggression and danger
literally: to sharpen someone's face; hence: = causative action by which humans increase the ability of others to assess different situations and react in an effective way
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

= a tree that reaches a height of 5 8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= produce from crop bearing trees and plants

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
read אֲבַדֹּון (אֲבַדֹּון) with |= abode of the dead; ≈ seen as a place extremely remote from the activities of everyday life but still accessible to God
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= a container, ◄ made of hardened clay, ► used for the smelting of ore; ≈ associated with times of testing and trial
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

= a construction ◄ made of hardened clay or of bricks ► and used for the smelting of ore or the firing of ceramic ware; ≈ often used figuratively to denote a prolonged period of hardship; also associated with times of testing and trial
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= a linker indicating that two propositions are proportional to one another in quantity, frequency, intensity, or content
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to other humans about who they are and what they do
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with the help of a pestle (עֱלִי) in a mortar (מַכְתֵּשׁ)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= a bowl shaped vessel ◄ usually made of stone or another strong material ► in which a substance such as seeds is pounded or crushed with a pestle (עֱלִי)
= a club shaped implement ◄ made of wood or stone ► for pounding or grinding substances in a mortar (מַכְתֵּשׁ)
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= objects that are considered valuable to have

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
literally: crown, diadem; hence: = state in which humans are in a position of authority
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= action by which a group of people leave their country because they are forced to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye
= a general term for plants, ► used as food by humans and animals; ≈ associated with frailty, but also with prosperity
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= young of a sheep (שֶׂה) either male or female; ► eaten at Passover, and used for sacrifice; its fleece is used for clothing
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= dominant male goat in a צֹאן (צֹאן) ≈ associated with authority
= state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

= a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
